themeSelector.tooltip: Change the theme of this website.
toolbar.dialog.content.error: A error occurred. This could be caused by incorrect webhook configuration, webhook provider returns error response, webhook provider's services are currently unavailable, etc.
settings.description: Change the behavior of this site or editor. Update the text to see the effect after changing the Serialization settings.
settings.serialization.gfm.hint: GitHub Flavored Markdown, a.k.a GFM, is a superset of [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/) specification. It is extended by GitHub, used to support advanced features like footnote, table, etc. Enable this option to serialize your Markdown texts as GitHub does (except issues references or any thing that related to a specified GitHub repository). [Learn more](https://github.github.com/gfm/#:~:text=GitHub%20Flavored%20Markdown%2C%20often%20shortened%20as%20GFM%2C%20is,dialect.%20GFM%20is%20a%20strict%20superset%20of%20CommonMark)
settings.serialization.externalLink: Add noreferrer and nofollow to external link
settings.serialization.externalLink.hint: The attributes noreferrer and nofollow are used to tell robots do not track or record this link.
settings.serialization.kaTeX.hint:
KaTeX is usually used to generate well-styled math formula on web pages. Enable this so that you can use: 
```markdown
$$
<!--KaTeX code goes here-->
$$
```
 to insert a formula into your articles. [Learn more](https://katex.org/docs/supported.html)
settings.webhook.method.hint: Specified HTTP method will be used to call webhook.
settings.webhook.parameterName.hint:
For `GET` method, the parameter name will be used as URL parameter's key:
```http
GET /?{parameterName}=... HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
```
 For other methods, it will be used as property name of JSON object which will be passed as HTTP request body: 
```http
POST / HTTP/1.1
Host: example.com
Content-Type: application/json

{
  "{parameterName}": "..."
}
```
